upload_data_message: Upload data to see interactive charts
upload_data_description: Charts will show strategy comparisons, correlations, and performance analysis
load_sample_description: Load Example-Portfolio.csv for testing and demonstration
initial_capital_help: Used to calculate portfolio values for real trade logs. Default: 100,000
drag_drop: Drag and drop your CSV file here, or click to browse
friendly_name_help: Give your portfolio a memorable name
upload_success: Success! Uploaded {{count}} trades from {{strategies}} strategies as "{{name}}"
file_too_large: File is too large. Maximum size is 50MB.
invalid_file_type: Invalid file type. Please upload a CSV file.
match_only_datetime_help: Skip strategy name matching (useful when strategy names differ significantly)
strategy_names_rule: Strategy Names: Backtest strategy names must be a substring of live strategy names (e.g., "Iron Condor" matches "Iron Condor (Tasty)")
time_matching_rule: Time Matching: Entry times can differ by up to 4 minutes 59 seconds between files
file_types_rule: File Types: Select one backtest file and one live trading file for comparison
datetime_only_rule: Date/Time Only: Use the checkbox to match trades based only on date/time, ignoring strategy names
tooltip_entry_datetime: Date and time when the trade was opened
tooltip_bt_strategy: Trading strategy name from backtest data
tooltip_bt_contracts: Number of contracts traded in backtest
tooltip_bt_exit_price: Exit price from backtest (slippage NOT removed)
tooltip_bt_close_time: Date and time when the backtest trade was closed
tooltip_bt_reason: Reason why the backtest trade was closed
tooltip_live_strategy: Trading strategy name from live data
tooltip_live_contracts: Number of contracts traded in live execution
tooltip_live_close_time: Date and time when the live trade was closed
tooltip_live_reason: Reason why the live trade was closed
tooltip_entry_diff: Difference between live and backtest entry prices (green=better live execution, red=worse)
tooltip_pnl_diff: Difference between live and backtest P&L (green=better live performance, red=worse)
mfe_mae_only_backtest: MFE/MAE analysis is only available for backtesting data with "Max Profit" and "Max Loss" columns.
cleanup_duplicates: Remove duplicate files, keeping only the most recent version
annual_risk_free_rate: Annual risk-free rate for Sharpe and Sortino ratio calculations
strategy_classification_explanation: Strategies are automatically classified as Bullish, Bearish, or Neutral based on their names and characteristics. This helps with portfolio diversification analysis.
blackout_dates_description: Analyze performance during specific date ranges
live_vs_bt_what_is: What is Live vs Backtest Comparison?
live_vs_bt_description: This tool compares your live trading performance with backtest results to identify execution differences and optimization opportunities.
live_vs_bt_execution_analysis: Execution Analysis: See how live trades performed vs backtest expectations
live_vs_bt_strategy_validation: Strategy Validation: Verify if backtest results translate to live performance
live_vs_bt_performance_gaps: Performance Gaps: Identify systematic differences between live and backtest
live_vs_bt_optimization: Optimization: Find opportunities to improve live execution
live_vs_bt_how_it_works: How it works: Select one backtest file and one live trading file. The system will match trades by date/time and strategy, then show side-by-side comparisons with P&L differences.
live_vs_bt_strategy_names_rule: Strategy Names: Backtest strategy names must be a substring of live strategy names (e.g., "Iron Condor" matches "Iron Condor (Tasty)")
live_vs_bt_time_matching_rule: Time Matching: Entry times can differ by up to 4 minutes 59 seconds between files
live_vs_bt_file_types_rule: File Types: Select one backtest file and one live trading file for comparison
live_vs_bt_datetime_only_rule: Date/Time Only: Use the checkbox to match trades based only on date/time, ignoring strategy names
live_vs_bt_match_datetime_help: Skip strategy name matching (useful when strategy names differ significantly)
selected_dates_help: This shows the dates included in the selected blackout list.
leave_empty_filename: Leave empty to use original filename
initial_capital_help_text: Used to calculate portfolio values for real trade logs. Default: 100,000
mfe_mae_analysis_subtitle: Maximum Favorable Excursion & Maximum Adverse Excursion
mfe_losing_trades_desc: How much profit losing trades saw before becoming losers (shows missed opportunities)
profit_kept_losing_desc: Always 0% since they ended up losing (shows they didn't capture the profit they saw)
mae_winning_trades_desc: How much pain winning trades endured before becoming profitable
pain_profit_ratio_desc: Ratio of maximum adverse excursion to final profit (lower is better - shows efficiency of profit capture)
mfe_winning_trades_desc: How much profit winning trades saw while open (shows profit potential)
profit_kept_winning_desc: What percentage of maximum profit was actually captured (higher is better - shows profit retention efficiency)
sample_trade_details_desc: Detailed breakdown of one sample winner and one sample loser for each strategy
drag_drop_csv: Drag and drop your CSV file here, or click to browse
drop_csv_here: Drop CSV here or click to browse
max_days_between: Max Days Between Blackout Date and Close Date:
max_days_help: For multi-day trades, maximum days between blackout date and trade close date (default: 5)
bullish_classification: üü¢ BULLISH: Market ‚Üë (+0.5%+) AND P&L > 0, OR Market ‚Üì (-0.5%+) AND P&L < 0
bearish_classification: üî¥ BEARISH: Market ‚Üì (-0.5%+) AND P&L > 0, OR Market ‚Üë (+0.5%+) AND P&L < 0
pie_chart_slice_desc: ‚Ä¢ Each slice = Individual strategy sized by |P&L|
pie_chart_hover_desc: ‚Ä¢ Hover for full strategy name and details
hold_ctrl_to_select: Hold Ctrl/Cmd to select multiple strategies. Leave empty to show all.
performance_note: Performance Note: Margin calculations are disabled by default for faster loading. Check the box above to include margin data (may slow down loading with large datasets).
your_score_means: Your Score: {score}% means your strategies have an average correlation of {correlation}%
find_strategies_independent: Find strategies that move independently to reduce overall risk
meic_recalculation_notice: Date range changed - click to recalculate heatmap
large_datasets_note: Large datasets may take longer to process
meic_heatmap_title: MEIC Performance Heatmap by Day of Week and Entry Time
meic_loading_timeout: MEIC loading timeout - dataset may be very large
what_is_cross_file_correlation: What is Cross-File Strategy Correlation Analysis?
cross_file_correlation_description: This tool analyzes the correlation between trading strategies from different CSV files to help you identify diversification opportunities.
portfolio_diversification_desc: Find strategies that move independently to reduce overall risk
cross_file_risk_management_desc: Avoid combining highly correlated strategies that amplify losses
performance_optimization_desc: Build portfolios with uncorrelated strategies for better risk-adjusted returns
conflicting_legs_description: Conflicting legs occur when you have opposing positions on the same contract during overlapping time periods. This analysis identifies trades that may be working against each other.
positions_cancel_out: Positions may cancel each other out
no_conflicting_legs_message: Great! No trades were found with opposing positions on the same contract during overlapping time periods.
strategy_pairs_in_conflicts: Strategy Pairs in Conflicts (ordered by frequency)
closing_commissions_backtest: Closing commissions from backtest data (excludes expired)
estimated_opening_commissions_live: Estimated opening commissions for live data
estimated_closing_commissions_live: Estimated closing commissions for live data (excludes expired)
monte_carlo_development_warning: This Monte Carlo simulation page is currently under development and should not be relied upon for trading decisions. The calculations and results may contain errors or inaccuracies.
leave_empty_historical: Leave empty to use same count as historical data
run_simulation_to_see: Run a simulation to see probability distributions and risk metrics
simulations_tooltip: Number of Monte Carlo simulation runs performed to generate statistical results
trades_per_simulation_tooltip: Number of trades randomly sampled in each simulation run
meic_analysis_requirements: MEIC (Multiple Entry Iron Condor) Analysis Requirements
meic_in_filename_or_strategy: "meic" must be in filename or strategy name
same_entry_date_time: Same entry date and time for both trades
no_meic_trades_found: No Multiple Entry Iron Condor (MEIC) trades were found in your data. To analyze MEIC trades, please ensure:
meic_naming_requirements: The word "meic" (case-insensitive) must appear in either:
meic_filename_or_strategy: The filename of your uploaded CSV file, OR
meic_strategy_name: The strategy name in your trade data
meic_leg_groups: MEIC trades must be organized in "leg groups"
meic_leg_group_desc: Each leg group consists of 2 trades placed at the same entry time:
meic_put_spread: One trade for the put spread (P strikes only)
meic_call_spread: One trade for the call spread (C strikes only)
meic_same_entry_time: Both trades must have the same entry date and time
meic_example_desc: For a MEIC trade group entered at 15:14:00 on 2025-09-05:
meic_put_example: Put Spread: "4 Sep 5 6470 P STO 1.95 | 4 Sep 5 6395 P BTO 0.05"
meic_call_example: Call Spread: "4 Sep 5 6485 C STO 2.20 | 4 Sep 5 6540 C BTO 0.05"
load_sample_meic_description: Load Example-Portfolio-MEIC.csv for testing and demonstration
meic_heatmap_description: Filter the date range to analyze how different time periods impact the MEIC heatmap performance and patterns.
price_movement_description: This tool analyzes trading performance based on the percentage price movement of the underlying symbol between trade opening and closing times. Filter trades by price movement range to see how your strategies perform in different market conditions.
vix_analysis_description: Analyze performance when both Opening VIX and Closing VIX fall within a selected range.
individual_trades_in_vix_range: Individual trades within the specified VIX range
tooltip_vix_pnl: Profit and Loss for the trade
tooltip_vix_summary_trade_count: Number of trades in the selected VIX range
tooltip_vix_summary_total_pnl: Total profit/loss for trades in range
tooltip_vix_summary_win_rate: Winning trades as a percentage of total
no_trades_in_vix_range: No trades found within the specified VIX range.
failed_to_load_price_movement_range: Failed to load price movement range data.
failed_to_load_price_movement_data: Failed to load price movement data:
blackout_dates_explanation: This tool analyzes trading performance on specific dates (like FOMC announcements, end of month, or end of quarter) to see how your strategies perform during these high-impact events.
fomc_description: Federal Reserve interest rate decision dates
eom_description: Last trading day of each month
eoq_description: Last trading day of each quarter
event_impact_desc: Understand how market events affect your trading performance
risk_management_desc: Identify high-risk periods and adjust position sizing
strategy_selection_desc: Choose strategies that perform well during specific events
timing_optimization_desc: Adjust entry/exit timing around known market events
how_it_works_desc: The analysis includes trades that were either initiated on blackout dates OR had any blackout date fall between the opening and closing dates (multi-day trades).
fomc_note: FOMC dates are static and cover 2021-2026. Update the list when new Fed schedules are published.
max_days_between_blackout: Max Days Between Blackout Date and Close Date:
no_trades_on_blackout_dates: No trades were initiated on the selected blackout dates
live_vs_bt_trades_tooltip: Total number of trades compared between live and backtest
live_vs_bt_avg_entry_diff_tooltip: Average difference between live and backtest entry prices
live_vs_bt_best_entry_diff_tooltip: Best (most favorable) entry price difference for this strategy
live_vs_bt_worst_entry_diff_tooltip: Worst (least favorable) entry price difference for this strategy
live_vs_bt_better_executions_tooltip: Number of trades where live execution was better than backtest
live_vs_bt_worse_executions_tooltip: Number of trades where live execution was worse than backtest
commission_analysis_description: Analyze commission costs and their impact on trading performance
commission_per_contract_tooltip: Average commission paid per contract traded
exercise_rate_tooltip: Percentage of contracts that were exercised
drawdown_description: Analyze portfolio drawdowns and recovery periods
win_rate_table_description: Detailed win rate analysis by strategy and time period
win_rate_by_day_of_week: Win Rate by Day of Week
risk_return_description: Analyze the relationship between risk and return for different strategies
correlation_matrix_description: Analyze correlations between different trading strategies
margin_analysis_description: Analyze margin requirements and utilization across strategies
monte_carlo_description: Simulate portfolio performance using Monte Carlo analysis
mfe_mae_description: Maximum Favorable Excursion and Maximum Adverse Excursion analysis
live_vs_backtest_description: Compare live trading performance with backtest results
files_overview_description: Manage and analyze your uploaded portfolio files
no_mfe_mae_data_available: No MFE/MAE data available for analysis.
portfolio_lines_desc: Blue line shows total account value, red area shows portfolio drawdown %
strategy_pnl_lines_desc: Click legend to show individual strategy cumulative P&L (dotted lines)
strategy_drawdown_desc: Each strategy has a drawdown % line (dashed lines) calculated against "Funds at Close"
daily_details_desc: Hover over any line to see day-by-day P&L and drawdown details
peak_tracking_desc: Tooltips show current P&L vs. peak P&L and days since peak
